decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of spells to quickly and efficiently execute a powerful combo strategy. It includes cards that allow for fast mana generation and card filtering, such as Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Once Upon a Time. The deck also includes cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer that enable the player to mill through their deck quickly and efficiently. The ultimate goal is to set up a graveyard full of cards and then utilize cards like Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle to win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a winning combination using the card Doomsday. The deck aims to use cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Personal Tutor to set up a powerful Doomsday pile that will allow the player to win on their next turn. The deck also includes various disruption spells such as Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Finally, cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond provide additional mana acceleration to enable quick and efficient plays.

This deck is centered around controlling the game and outlasting opponents with its wide range of control spells and card advantage. The key concept of the deck is to establish board control using cards like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, while also mitigating opponent's threats with countermagic such as Force of Will and Force of Negation. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection options with Brainstorm and Ponder, making sure to keep a consistent flow of resources. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad adds additional value by blinking permanents and generating card advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and dish out consistent damage to the opponent through aggressive creature plays and efficient removal spells. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Chalice of the Void and Archon of Emeria while also utilizing powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Solitude for both offense and defense. With a mix of land acceleration and mana rocks, the deck can ensure consistent and explosive plays, overwhelming the opponent and forcing them to react to the aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various means such as countering spells, disrupting the opponent's strategies, and manipulating the top of the deck. It utilizes a combination of powerful blue and white cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Will, along with versatile green cards like Up the Beanstalk and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes strong removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus, as well as card draw and deck manipulation tools like Ponder and Brainstorm. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Orcish Bowmasters adds additional disruption and control elements.

The deck revolves around control elements and resource denial. It focuses on using counterspells (Force of Will and Force of Negation) and removal (Swords to Plowshares) to control the game. It also utilizes card filtering (Ponder, Brainstorm) to find the right cards at the right time. The deck includes land destruction (Wasteland) to disrupt opponents' mana base. Additionally, it has recursion (Life from the Loam) and card advantage engines (Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath) to maintain card advantage and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and control the game through a combination of disruption and card advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a fast pace. It achieves this by utilizing cards like Wasteland and Lightning Bolt to control the opponent's resources, while using counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to disrupt their plans. The deck also focuses on card advantage with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Mishra's Bauble. The creatures in the deck, such as Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, provide a threat that can quickly close out the game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with high power and toughness early in the game to quickly pressure the opponent. It also aims to gain a tempo advantage by utilizing cards that provide additional mana, such as Lotus Petal and Chrome Mox. The deck further disrupts the opponent's game plan by using Chalice of the Void to counter low-cost spells. It includes some individual powerhouse cards such as Timeless Dragon and Éowyn, Fearless Knight to provide additional value and win conditions. The mana base is designed to provide fast mana and ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to combine the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 indestructible creature token with flying and trample. The deck includes cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying to search for Dark Depths, as well as Mox Diamond and Green Sun's Zenith for ramp and consistency. Additionally, the deck includes other utility cards like Knight of the Reliquary, Swords to Plowshares, and Sylvan Library to provide further support and flexibility. The mana base includes various fetch lands, dual lands, and utility lands to support the combo and ensure consistent mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and quickly defeat the opponent. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Troll of Khazad-dûm, while also using disruptive spells like Grief and Sauron's Ransom to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a reanimation package with cards like Reanimate and Sheoldred's Edict to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard. Additionally, the deck includes counter spells like Daze and Force of Will for added protection and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the game by utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, Snuff Out, and Hymn to Tourach, while also leveraging powerful creatures that can quickly close out the game like Orcish Bowmasters, Murktide Regent, and Troll of Khazad-dûm. The deck also features a reanimation strategy with cards like Reanimate and Grief, allowing for explosive plays and graveyard recursion. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on while disrupting the opponent's game plan and maintaining card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to use the combo card Doomsday alongside various cantrips and rituals to quickly cycle through the deck and set up a winning combination. By using cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Lotus Petal, the player can manipulate their deck to achieve the optimal outcome. The inclusion of Thassa's Oracle and the One Ring suggest that the deck aims to win by either creating a large storm count or by setting up a specific combination of cards to win the game in one turn. The deck also includes disruption cards like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect and support the combo.

The main concept of this Legacy Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent by using aggressive, low-cost creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Grief. The deck focuses on disruption and control, utilizing cards like Sudden Edict and Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also has a strong late-game presence with powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Archfiend of the Dross. The deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total and control the board through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Storm deck focuses on quickly generating mana and drawing cards to set up for a big combo turn. It uses cards like Chrome Mox, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Lotus Petal to generate fast mana, while Brainstorm and Ponder help with card selection and digging for key pieces. The deck also utilizes cards like Cabal Ritual and Dark Ritual to generate even more mana. The key combo pieces are Ad Nauseam and Gaea's Will, which allow the player to draw and play a significant portion of their deck in one turn, culminating in a powerful Tendrils of Agony for lethal damage.

The main concept of this deck is to apply aggressive pressure on the opponent using a combination of low-cost and efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Sprite Dragon. It also utilizes disruptive spells such as Daze and Force of Will to counter opposing threats and maintain control over the game. The deck aims to deal consistent damage through burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Price of Progress, while also utilizing card manipulation tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble helps generate card advantage and provide additional information about the opponent's deck. The deck also has some land disruption with Wasteland to hinder the opponent's mana development.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive artifacts, specifically focusing on the color Blue. The deck uses cards like Aether Spellbomb, Shadowspear, and Triangle of War to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also dealing damage. It also includes powerful artifact creatures like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Patchwork Automaton to quickly apply pressure. The deck further enhances its artifact synergy with cards like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal for mana acceleration, and cards like Urza's Bauble and Mishra's Bauble for card draw. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive artifact creatures and disruption.

This deck focuses on aggressive artifact strategies in the Legacy 1 vs 1 format. It utilizes a combination of powerful artifacts and creature cards to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. The deck includes cards such as Pithing Needle and Tormod's Crypt to disrupt the opponent's strategy, as well as cards like The Mightstone and Weakstone to boost its own creatures. It also features cards like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal to ramp up mana production, allowing for faster plays. The deck is centered around the synergy between artifacts and creatures, aiming to overwhelm and outpace the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively apply pressure to the opponent using low-cost creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Questing Druid, and Tarmogoyf. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck includes efficient removal spells like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt to clear the way for its creatures. The deck's mana base consists of fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and maintain a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It utilizes aggressive creatures like Mother of Runes, Orcish Bowmasters, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to attack the opponent's life total. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Skyclave Apparition, Thoughtseize, and Opposition Agent to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also has a strong focus on equipment, with Stoneforge Mystic and Batterskull providing additional threats. Additionally, it has a versatile companion in Yorion, Sky Nomad, which allows for more flexibility and card advantage. The deck is well-rounded and aims to win through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo involving Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle to win the game. It includes various ways to efficiently dig for the combo pieces, protect them from disruption, and produce the necessary mana. The deck also includes elements to help set up the combo, such as Personal Tutor and Brainstorm. The mana base is designed to provide the necessary color fixing and consistency for the combo to go off successfully. Overall, the deck revolves around quickly and efficiently executing the Doomsday combo to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deploy powerful creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck focuses on aggressive plays and uses creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Goblin Rabblemaster to deal damage quickly. It also utilizes cards like Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to enhance the power of its creatures. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements such as Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Blood Moon to hinder the opponent's strategy. The mana base consists of Ancient Tomb, City of Traitors, and other lands that provide quick and efficient mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Goblin Rabblemaster. The deck aims to lock out the opponent from casting spells effectively while dealing damage quickly with hasty creatures and burn spells like Fury. Additionally, the deck has a toolbox of artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator to further disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this Legacy Aggro - Initiative Stompy deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining control of the tempo of the game. By utilizing powerful creatures like Archon of Emeria and Solitude, along with efficient mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence. The inclusion of Chalice of the Void and Forth Eorlingas! provide additional disruption against opposing strategies, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive edge and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game and generate value through the interaction between lands and creatures. The deck aims to control the board and the opponent's resources using cards such as Swords to Plowshares and Mox Diamond. It also utilizes the lands by utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Knight of the Reliquary to search for specific lands and generate additional land value. Additionally, the deck has some graveyard synergy with cards like Life from the Loam and Bojuka Bog. Overall, the deck focuses on resource management, land synergy, and control strategies to win the game.

The key concept of this deck is to use the combo between Painter's Servant and Grindstone for a game-ending effect. By naming a color with Painter's Servant, Grindstone mills the opponent's entire deck, potentially leading to an instant win. The deck includes various cards that support this combo, such as Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, which can tutor for both Painter's Servant and Grindstone. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Pyroblast and Goblin Engineer to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with powerful creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck makes use of cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, Archon of Cruelty, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier as win conditions. Supporting this strategy, there are also disruptive elements like Grief and Dauthi Voidwalker to disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck also includes tutors like Entomb and Urza's Saga to find the necessary pieces for the combo.

The main concept of this deck is to use the combo of Show and Tell along with Sneak Attack to cheat powerful creatures into play, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Lotus Petal to generate extra mana and acceleration. Additional protection and disruption is provided through the use of counterspells like Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and Veil of Summer. Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain help with card selection and manipulation. The deck includes a mix of lands to provide different types of mana sources.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combo of Show and Tell and Sneak Attack to quickly drop powerful creatures onto the battlefield, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes cards like Lotus Petal, Spell Pierce, and Veil of Summer to protect and support the combo. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of counter spells like Force of Will and card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and adaptability. The mana base includes a combination of Islands, Mountains, and dual lands to support the deck's mana requirements.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's plans by countering their spells, removing their threats, and maintaining a strong hand with cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler, which further enhance its control capabilities. Additionally, it has access to board wipes like Supreme Verdict and efficient removal in the form of Prismatic Ending. Overall, the deck focuses on outlasting the opponent and maintaining control of the game state.
